meanings.definition: Consisting of or marked by patches
meanings.sent1: The patchy quilt had squares of different colors sewn together.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a patchy technique to create a unique painting with various textures.
meanings.sent3: The patchy clouds in the sky looked like pieces of cotton scattered around.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event was patchy, like a puzzle missing some pieces.
meanings.sent5: The patchy lawn was a mix of green grass and brown spots, creating an interesting pattern.

meanings.definition: Inconsistent or uneven in quality or performance
meanings.sent1: The team's patchy performance led to a tie in the game.
meanings.sent2: Her work on the project was patchy, with some parts well-done and others rushed.
meanings.sent3: The patchy Wi-Fi signal made it difficult to stream videos smoothly.
meanings.sent4: His patchy attendance at meetings raised concerns about his commitment.
meanings.sent5: The patchy service at the restaurant left customers feeling dissatisfied with their experience.
